lines.text: I am sick at my heart when my own son goes looking at dead women's naked bodies. I tell you Morris, it is no way to treat a lady.
You look... you look very pretty.
I took two hours getting ready for this.
It looks... it looks natural!
That's why it took two hours! Getting dolled up is easy. Looking natural takes time.
You still don't have a diploma! Not to mention any grandchildren, which your brother Franklin has three already. Three grandchildren. What have I got from you but heartbreak?
So, what do you, what do you do with her, go to mass?
No, we just... we walk and we talk.
Oh, please, please. I don't want to hear another word. Already I won't sleep another wink tonight. Please, don't say another word.
[pause]
Morris...
I thought you didn't want to hear any more?
Aw, you think I want to? You think I want... I'm in agony. I... I... It's my duty. Go on, go on.
Well, she... her, her name is Katherine. Katherine. Katherine Palmer.
Short, blonde, beautiful?
No, she's, er, she's, she's tall and er, she's only got one eye right in the middle of her forehead.
Of course. Of course. She'll break your heart!
Are you tender, Morris? You can have me if you say "yes."
[Preparing to meet Morris' mother]
Do you love me?
Yes!
Desperately, madly?
Desperately, madly!
In that case, I can move mountains. Let's go.
Morris, look at this apartment! I love it! It's so Jewish!
That girl is a gem! An absolute gem! And I'll tell you something else...
What?
She reminds me of me!
Is that one of your own wigs you're wearing?
You don't look like Cleopatra, honey.
Don't raise your voice!
You homo.
Doesn't mean you're a bad person.
So where you going to take her?
Who?
Kate Palmer.
Nowhere.
Nowhere? That's a place, nowhere?
We're going to have dinner at her place.
You mean her own apartment?
That's right.
The two of you, alone?
Well, we were going to invite the strangler, but he couldn't make it.
Oh, sure, sure. Make fun. Ridicule.
